|Description=Describe the systematic search for primary cancer in the presence of cerebral metastasis
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Dr Thiébaud PICART (Hospices Civils de Lyon),Dr Pierre ANTHÉRIEU (Toulouse University Hospital),Pr François VASSAL (Saint-Etienne University Hospital)
|Order=7}}

'''Extension work-up:''' look for primary cancer (and other extra-encephalic systemic metastases)

- '''Clinical:'''

o Skin examination (melanoma)

o Pulmonary auscultation

o Breast palpation, adenopathy

- '''Imaging:'''

o ''Thoracic-abdominal-pelvic scan'', with injection of contrast medium

o +/- fluorodeoxyglucose PET scanner (<sup>18</sup>F)

o Mammography in women

question.question: What is the recommended approach to search for primary cancer in the presence of cerebral metastasis?
question.option_a: Perform a thorough physical examination focusing only on the skin and breast
question.option_b: Conduct a thoracic-abdominal-pelvic scan with contrast medium, as well as mammography in women, and consider fluorodeoxyglucose PET scanner if necessary
question.option_c: Limit the search to the thoracic-abdominal-pelvic region only, without considering other potential sites of primary cancer
question.option_d: Skip the search for primary cancer and focus solely on treating the cerebral metastasis
